Comment: Did anyone else notice that Chef Devaux is amazingly ambidextrous? This is awesome. Thank you How To Make Sushi ! After I try a few of your easier creations, I will embark on this Tiger Sushi for my mum! Michelle from Canada
Another absolutely incredible video. And to top it all, you are a talented artist.
You give such detailed, step by step directions. Thank you Chef Devaux. I shall try this when I gather the all the items!!
It's so cool I love to make sushi and I will try this one day! It's brilliant! GOOD JOB!!!
WOW!!!!! You are truly an artist!!!! LOVE IT!! You make everything look so simple yet it is not!
Love it ! You did an amazing job :D
So creative and good for dining room decor. Love this channel <3
Beautiful work. I did the salmon tartar roll from your other video and loved it. If I ever get around to making the tiger I'll add a link. Thanks, Chef!

Absolutely brilliant!!!
DEFINITELY going to try this one!
And thank you so much for the Locust Bean Gum tip!
I used Agar Agar in a dessert recipe and hated the results as the gelee I was making was far too firm. In the future I will use your tip...thank you!
I just love your videos. They are well presented and your verbal instructions are very well articulated.
Thanks again
You've topped everything you've done before with this one. Just amazing. Great job
I like this video and all the other sushi art videos!!!! I have been watching these videos with my mom since 7 years old!
I love watching your videos, makes me want to try and make Sushi.
That's Awesome. I'd be so afraid to see the pricetag for this item if I ordered it at a sushi bar lol.
SO cool. This reminds me of the dragon one he did awhile back. I think these types of things are the most creative.
That's a work of art! Wish I could taste it.

I wanted to try this but couldn't find all the ingredients, so instead this morning i made it with omelette and nori cut into strips then cut across into a triangular stripe. It worked really well, I just took out some egg white and added an extra yolk to make it more orange. next up, sushi safari
This is SOOO awesome!! :D I will definitely share this on FB, that thumbnail alone got me to watch, so I'm sure my FB friends will watch it as well. :)
Wow! Amazing job! Loved it!
Shared! You do amazing work totally blown away by your talent!
Thank you for this tutorial; it is wonderfully detailed. Will make a great centerpiece for the Clemson/LSU game January 13th!

I was brought here because of my love and admiration for sushi. You kept me here by just being you. You put our a ton of free, and otherwise expensive, knowledge out there. You have a kind and honest persona. You're easy to look at and watch. Your edits are really nice and you use very refreshing and chill-type music. And, last but not least, you make sushi more than just an art to show off to other people; you make it so it's possible others can do the same thing. One of the things on my bucket list is to grab a small crew and go around meeting all of the people I admire on my YouTube channel, then documenting it and see their reactions and such. I don't plan to meet everyone that I am subscribed to... just saying though, it would be fun to give the same courtesy to others as they do for the "youtube" community.
I like watching your vids because not only are your directions clear and you show step by step how it should look, but it's always delicious and beautiful as well.

I never cease to be impressed by your creativity & tutorials. (= A must-see channel for every sushi lover!
Thank you for inspiring me to make sushi myself over a year ago!
I love sushi...and you make each piece so artistic that it becomes addictive to watch...plus you have cool tricks like the wasabi flower, cucumber whale, and carrot leaves. Good job!
Because of your clean and slick sushi making skills, you made them look so easy! Clear explanations and straight to the point. Keep it up! These look amazingly delicious by the way

Chef Devaux instructional videos on to do it yourself sushi making for home cooks is indeed a unique added value. I highly recommend all sushi hobbyists to watch and follow him for his simplicity and perfection in an art that has been so far considered as being extremely difficult and complicated. My personal deep thanks for sharing your skilled knowledge Chef !
I love your videos, their absolutely amazing, and I hope to try a recipe one of these days!
I watch them because I love making sushi myself and your recipes are always so refreshing and different makes me want to try different things as well. Keep up the great work.
I made this roll a few days ago. It's hella good. I want my sushi to be like restaurant sushi and I've kinda mastered it. Sometimes I have to tell myself Bae, you did that. This is excellent.

the reason i watch your videos is for a variety of reasons, sushi is probably my favorite type of food out there i have always enjoyed it for as long as i can remember. also i view sushi as a sort of food art and the way you prepare your sushi and the amount of detail you put into the garnishes is simply awe inspiring to me, the devotion you put into your videos and your sushi is amazing and i will continue to watch these videos to watch these videos to learn and be entertained. P.S. i made that ginger salsa and loved it with some salmon i grilled.

I personally watch not only because your videos are, for lack of a better word, awesome. But I also watch because sushi has been a food I have been interested in since I first saw it made as a kid and I haven't seen many better videos. I'm now looking to get into the industry and these are a major help. So thank you chef for doing what you do.
I really enjoying watching your channel for improving technique. Started making sushi beginning of the year and you've been a big help, thanks for the lessons!

It's a combination of entertainment and education for me. I enjoy watching you make things because of how relaxed you are and that you use SI units! But also you of course teach the different varieties of sushi rolls. I like making what you show also. Greetings from Canada!

Chef, I really enjoy watching your videos - they are both entertaining & informative. I am in the process of learning to make my own sushi & your instructions are very good for a novice like me. Thank you!
Also love your garnish videos - so useful for prettying up party platters of less interesting food!
I started watching your videos because you had such a unique and personal touch to your beautiful rolls and even your garnishes, and I wish to prepare well-made sushi to my family someday :)

I watch because I love sushi, your videos are entertaining, and many of your recipes are downright artistic. I'm a foodie so all of those things got me hooked on "How to Make Sushi!" I have never made sushi but I totally intend on trying some of your recipes (like the one above).
I absolutely love watching your channel man!  Thanks for sharing your knowledge of sushi making.  It has inspired me to step outside the box, and step up my game!  Thanks brian
I love watching how sushi is prepared and the different recipes, they make my mouth water. It also reminds me that I seriously don't eat enough asian cuisine as I probably should.

I've been rolling sushi for a couple of years now, and very much enjoy your presentations and rolls, especially the more artistic ones (dragon roll, panda roll, etc.). MUCH THX for this series of vids!
Thank you for your videos, I learned alot from you...so much in fact I got a job as a sushi chef
Well chef you’ve come up with a winner again ! I’m on a low carb diet and this fits the bill , I might even try some with cooked shrimp , or crab meat , great video , keep um coming

Beautiful! Thank you so much! I have lunch with my Dad once a week and we always cook something fun. He’s going to love this! You are such a wonderful teacher, lending the confidence to us to jump in and try. You also look just like my brother lol. Hope you have a lovely rest of your week, Chef

Holy shit - I just started watching a bunch of your videos and all were pre 2019. Just watched this one and realized it's from 2 days ago. Good to see you're still uploading content (great content!) Thanks for all of it. As someone who picked up the art of sushi making during the pandemic, I enjoy watching chefs like you and Chef Hiroyuki Terada's channels. Thanks again!!!
What an amazing video! Love the roll! Great work Chef!
Beautiful, simple, delicious ingredients and healthy. Thank you!
looks very refreshing for this summer!

I was wondering recently:
"Where is that great How To Make Sushi Channel content?"
And there it is! Thanks. 
I am not joking :) your content is that good - people are thinking about it even when you don't post.
Great to have you back making videos. I think I followed because I started upping my Sushi rice (and house soy) game and I really can't pay you back for that gift.
Looks yummy
Yep man, i am watching and learning lots from my childhood  with you
Yummy , I’ll try  it sometime.
Delicious!
ITS GREAT to see you making videos again!!!
Another good recipe
